comments:
After I open the Preferences dialog and get into File Associations I try to 
assign a new editor to a file type. I do not get any dialog that allows me to 
select either an internal or external editor. I also do not get any type of 
indication what the UI is doing and if it had an error. I did open the .log 
file and found that the UI is getting a null pointer exception. I will attach 
the .log portion for this bug.

*** Bug 32005 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

The problem you are having is that somehow one of the editors you have is 
managing to get a null image descriptor. There appears to be an invalid editor 
that has some of variant in its definition that we aren't testing for.

Could you check your fille associations and see if any of them are coming up 
without and image? Also could you export your preferences and attach them to 
this problem report?  

Also are you running with straight Eclipse or do you have any other plug-ins 
installed? If so are any of them ones we provide?

I systematically removed the addotional plug-ins and found the the Struts 
Console 3.2.0 plug-in was causing the problem. Since I found which plug-in was 
causing the problem I did not think you would need my preferences, but if you 
still need them please let me know.
No that should be fine - thanks for letting me know.

This struts plug-in does not appear to be one of the ones that ship with WSAD 
5.0 - could you please zip it up and attach it to this Bug so that I can test 
with it?

Created an attachment (id=3530)
Struts Console Eclipse Plug-in 3.2.0 1 of 2

Here is the first of two zip files that contains the plug-in that was causing
me problems with the File Associations Preferences dialog.

Created an attachment (id=3531)
Struts Console Eclipse Plug-in 3.2.0 2 of 2

Here is the second of two zip files that contains the plug-in that was causing
me problems with the File Associations Preferences dialog. After you have both
zip files, unzip them into your Eclipse plugins directory.

Fixed in build >20020318 - we were not handling the null icon case correctly 
(it is documented that no icon is legal).

Thanks for all of your help Eric.
